intro: Rodriguezia stenochila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rodriguezia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the cashew and sumac. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically orange or red in color when mature. Rodriguezia stenochila is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
